page.title: 05DALWOOD FAIR
page.content: Dalwood has held a Fair for 640 years. King Edward 111 granted Dalwood a Fair Charter in 1345 and a copy of the charter can still be seen in the village church. The Fair is held to celebrate the Feast of St Peter and St Paul.The Fair was important to the village because they could buy and sell their produce. All of the money went to the Lord of the Manor. The Fair is now held in August for one week. It begins with a procession. There are stalls, amusements, handicrafts and teas in the village hall provided by the W.I ,the W.I also serve the teas.The money made at the fair now is shared between the school the village hall and all of the other clubs and associations in Dalwood. Other than the procession on the first day there are things like Morris Dancing and sometimes a play.
